DOC.brief_title: Bioequivalence Study Tretinoin Gel 0.05 % Brand Tretinoin Gel
DOC.detailed_description: This double-blind , randomize , three-treatment , parallel study conduct three location single investigator . Normal , healthy male female child adult ( i.e. , age 12 40 year ) least Grade 2 ( i.e. , mild severity ) acne vulgaris treat full face daily 84 day Tretinoin Gel 0.05 % , Brand ( tretinoin ) Gel 0.05 % , Gel Vehicle . Acne lesion grade single blind observer screening Weeks 0 ( i.e. , baseline ) , 2 , 4 , 8 , 12 location . The assigned study treatment self-applied topically daily 84 consecutive day . Scheduled study visit include : - Visit 1 ( Baseline Visit , Day 0 ) - Visit 2 ( First Interim Visit , Day 14 ) - Visit 3 ( Second Interim Visit , Day 28 ) - Visit 4 ( Third Interim Visit , Day 56 ) - Visit 5 ( Forth Interim Visit , Day 84 ) A window ± 4 day consider acceptable schedule visit follow Baseline Visit . Subjects admit study clinical diagnosis acne vulgaris meet inclusion/exclusion criterion . During study visit , follow procedure perform : - Counts inflammatory , non-inflammatory , nodulocystic lesion - The Investigator 's Global Assessment ( IGA ) - Assessment application site reaction Safety assess monitor AEs document sign and/or symptom application site reaction .
DOC.criteria: Normal , healthy male female child adult age 12 40 year Written verbal informed consent obtain . Subjects age 12 17 year , sign assent study parent legal guardian sign inform consent Women childbearing potential nonpregnant nonnursing , willing avoid pregnancy course study menstrual cycle follow completion participation study . Adequate contraception define systemic birth control , oral contraceptive , three month prior implantable/injectable contraceptive ( e.g. , Norplant , intrauterine device [ IUD ] ) six month prior study drug administration ; barrier method , diaphragm plus spermicide condom plus spermicide , consistently least 14 day prior study drug administration ; abstinence . On face , ≥ 20 inflammatory ( i.e. , papule pustule ) ≥ 25 noninflammatory ( i.e. , open close comedo ) lesion ≤ 2 nodulocystic lesion ( i.e , nodule cyst ) , per FDA Draft Guidance Tretinoin , date March 20 Able refrain use topical acne medication antibiotics treatment period Considered reliable capable understanding responsibility role study Presence skin condition would interfere diagnosis assessment acne vulgaris ( e.g. , face : rosacea , dermatitis , psoriasis , squamous cell carcinoma , eczema , acneform eruption cause medication , steroid acne , steroid folliculitis , bacterial folliculitis ) . Note : Eczema psoriasis body exclusion . Subjects active cystic acne evidence 2 facial nodule . Nodules define 7.3.3 : deepseated skin ( i.e. , center dermis subcutis ) great 5 mm diameter . More 40 papule and/or pustule ( inflammatory lesion ) . More 60 open and/or close comedones/milia ( noninflammatory lesion ) . Overall severity grade le 2 great 4 . History allergy hypersensitivity tretinoin , retinoids , study medication ingredient . Significant history clinical evidence autoimmune , cardiovascular , gastrointestinal , hematological , hepatic , neurological , pancreatic , renal disease . Use within 6 month prior baseline systemic retinoid ( isotretinoin ) treatment therapeutic vitamin A supplement great 10,000 units/day ( multivitamin allow ) . Oral contraceptive start change within 3 month prior study initiation plan change study . Use face within 1 month prior baseline 1 ) cryodestruction chemodestruction , 2 ) dermabrasion , 3 ) photodynamic therapy , 4 ) acne surgery , 5 ) intralesional steroid , 6 ) xray therapy . Use within 1 month prior baseline 1 ) spironolactone , 2 ) systemic steroid , 3 ) systemic antibiotic , 4 ) systemic treatment acne vulgaris ( oral retinoids , require 6month washout ) , 5 ) systemic antiinflammatory agent . Use within 2 week prior baseline 1 ) topical steroid , 2 ) topical retinoids , 3 ) topical acne treatment include overthecounter preparation , 4 ) topical antiinflammatory agent , 5 ) topical antibiotic . Pregnant breastfeeding . Serious psychological illness . Significant history ( within past year ) alcohol drug abuse .
